title: Inwood Film Festival
description: Columbia University’s Campbell Sports Center hosts the Inwood Film Festival, with screenings both in-person and online.
address: Columbia University’s Campbell Sports Center, Inwood

title: NewFest LGBTQ+ Film Festival: Pride Edition
description: Various screenings at SVA Theatre, Gansevoort Plaza, and online.

title: The 24th Annual Open Roads: New Italian Cinema Festival
description: Film at Lincoln Center hosts the Open Roads festival featuring new Italian cinema.

title: Shaping American Art: A Celebration of the Art Students League of New York at 150
description: The Art Students League of New York's 150th anniversary exhibition traces the league’s influence on American art.
address: Phyllis Harriman Mason Gallery, Midtown West

title: Hudson Classical Theater Company: Julius Caesar
description: Hudson Classical Theater Company celebrates its 22nd summer season with intimate, outdoor productions of Julius Caesar.
address: Soldiers’ and Sailors’ Monument, Riverside Park, UWS

title: Brooklyn Ceramic Arts Tour
description: A borough-wide celebration of all things clay brings together local ceramic artists, studios, galleries, and shops for open houses, exhibitions, hands-on workshops, demos, artist talks, and sales.

title: Emerge125 Dance Company's 2025 NYC Season at El Museo del Barrio
description: Emerge125, a Harlem-based black female-led dance company, hosts its 2025 season featuring a mix of reimagined masterpieces and world premieres.

title: Mobile Unit's Much Ado About Nothing
description: The Public Theater's Mobile Unit celebrates 15 years with a bilingual, family-friendly musical take of Shakespeare's classic.
address: Various locations across all five boroughs

title: Free Outdoor Movies
description: Various free outdoor movie screenings at different parks.

title: Collective Scream Presents: A Benefit for Mayday Space
description: A benefit concert for Mayday Space featuring performances from various artists.

title: Winging It: An Open Mic Night at Lofty Pigeon Books
description: An open mic night held at Kensington’s Lofty Pigeon Books, hosted by Emily Flake.

title: Golden Spiral Comedy Show
description: Stand-up set lengths follow the Fibonacci sequence at this comedy show in the East Village.

title: Power Suit Comedy Cabaret
description: A comedy cabaret send-up of #girlboss culture with various performances.

title: Not in My Backyard! A Political Comedy Roundtable
description: A panel of comedians, journalists, and politicians debate local issues in a roundtable format.

title: Free Kayaking at Brooklyn Bridge Park
description: Free kayaking returns to Brooklyn Bridge Park for the season, offering 20-minute rides with views of the Brooklyn Bridge and downtown Manhattan. Life vests, equipment, and instruction are provided. Advance registration is required.

title: Bryant Park and Prospect Park Yoga
description: Free outdoor yoga returns to Bryant Park and Prospect Park with a rotating lineup of instructors and a welcoming atmosphere for all experience levels. BYO mat or towel and water.

title: The Waiting Room
description: Following its 2024 premiere at the Edinburgh Fringe Festival, The Waiting Room comes to NYC with an AI-driven immersive experience—part interactive game, part theatre—that explores the nature of our choices and their impact on the future. Bring a charged smartphone or tablet and earphones/headphones for a personalized experience.

title: The 27th Cityvisions: City College of New York's Showcase of New Thesis Films
description: Free admission to the showcase of new thesis films at SVA Theater.

title: Manhattanhenge
description: Catch a striking urban sunset that happens only twice a year when the setting sun lines up perfectly with Manhattan's street grid.

title: 1,000 Free Spam Burgers
description: Casa 13urger and Spam celebrate National Hamburger Day with 1,000 free Spam burgers at Casa 13urger's Lower East Side location.

title: Letters + Sodas: LIC Reading Series One-Year Anniversary Show
description: Writer Lana Schwartz brings together comedians and writers for a night of standup, humor pieces, fiction, and essay readings at The Greats of Craft.

title: We Have Fun: A Stand-Up Show
description: Hosts Zach Sims and Dan Wilbur bring the fun-ny to Young Ethel’s with stand-up by various comedians.

title: Ditmas Lit
description: A diverse range of fiction writers, storytellers, poets, and essayists share their work at the Ditmas Lit series.

title: The Moth StorySlam
description: The popular community-based open mic storytelling competition returns to The Bell House, where anyone can share a five-minute tale based on the evening’s theme.
